channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: What's at stake in the U.S.-Iran nuclear talks?
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with former Iran nuclear negotiator Seyed Hossein Mousavian about the ongoing talks between the U.S. and Iran over the latter's nuclear program.

item.title: The Edmonton Oilers and Florida Panthers head to the Stanley Cup finals
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow talks to Daniel Nugent-Bowman of The Athletic about the Edmonton Oilers and the Florida Panthers facing off for the Stanley Cup finals for a second year in a row.

item.title: What makes for a good summer movie? NPR staffers discuss
item.description: NPR staffers take on a perennial question: What makes for a good summer movie?

item.title: On 'Paradise Now,' singer Obongjayar draws on numerous inspirations
item.description: Singer Obongjayar talks about a few standout songs from his new album, "Paradise Now."

item.title: Recruiting scientists from the U.S. to Europe
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with research scientist Maria Mota about her recent piece in the science journal "Nature" entitled, "Europe can capture the US brain drain â€” if it acts fast."

item.title: As Ukraine war drags on, what does Russian President Vladimir Putin want?
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Angela Stent, professor emeritus at Georgetown University, about what motivates Russian President Vladimir Putin as talks to end the war in Ukraine continue.

item.title: Endurance swimmer circles Martha's Vineyard to raise awareness of shark loss
item.description: Endurance swimmer Lewis Pugh is completed the first solo swim around the island of Martha's Vineyard, to raise awareness for shark populations.

item.title: Drag artists are getting attacked. This safety handbook aims to help
item.description: A group of drag queens from across the country and their supporters are releasing a handbook to help performers navigate a landscape of increasing threats of harassment and violence.

item.title: Businesses and trading partners are in limbo after a pair of federal court rulings
item.description: Imports to the U.S. fell sharply last month, as President Trump's worldwide tariffs took effect. But the future of those tariffs is in question after a pair of federal court rulings this week.

item.title: Hamas says it sent its response to U.S. ceasefire proposal
item.description: Hamas has responded to a U.S. ceasefire proposal in Gaza that includes the release of around half of its remaining living hostages.
